page.title: 01Gazetteer
page.content: This block was surveyed by the 2nd Year pupils of Campsmount School, Doncaster,a co-educational comprehensive serving areas as far afield as Smeaton and Thorpe-in-Balne, but mainly the villages of Askern, Campsall and Norton. The survey reveals a largely rural area and yet,typically of this part of South Yorkshire,the skyline is dominated by coal-mine and coalite plant,the fumes from which pervade the atmosphere.Our block includes only part of Instoneville,the Askern pit estate,but it is this community which is reflected in our written text. The area is lacking in amenities of a commercial nature but some recent effort has been made to utilise the open spaces belonging to the Local Authority to provide recreational facilities for walking,fishing,games.
